name: Pickled Carrot Slices
description: A garlicky spiced brine lends depth to these pickled carrot slices, and a final sprinkling of fresh dill adds spark.
keywords: carrot, garlic, white wine vinegar, fall, winter, side dish
recipeIngredient: 1 pound medium carrots, peeled, in 1/4-inch diagonal slices
2 tablespoons freshly snipped dill, for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: In stainless steel pot, make brine: combine vinegar, sugar, salt, cloves, bay leaf, caraway, coriander, garlic and hot peppers. Add 2 cups water and bring to a boil.

Reduce heat to a brisk simmer and add carrots. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes, until still quite firm. Remove carrots and spread out to cool on platter or baking sheet. Let brine come to room temperature. Put carrots in glass or plastic container, and pour brine over them. Let marinate several hours, refrigerated. May be prepared ahead and refrigerated for up to 4 days. Serve sprinkled with fresh dill.
